page.title: 04Religion in Retford
page.content: The highest{density of churches}occurs in70,81,71,81.Anglican,Catholic,Baptis t and Methodists are represented. St. Swithun's C E (12th century) serves the{ancient borough parish}of East Retford.St. Michael's (1277)serve s the larger parish of West Retford. The{Pilgrim Fathers}worshipped in the area before fleeing to Holland. The other churches are relatively modern,St.Saviour's (1829) was built to serve a growing population in the Clarborough parish. Methodist churches have relocated several times.Grove Str. is an established church while Hallcroft Chapel is new. St.Joseph's Catholic church serves Retford and district.The Baptist church and Salvation Hall form the other denominations.
